description: Ms. codex. Physical description: 19 lines per page; written in nastaʻliq script in black on white European glazed, laid paper. Rubrication and catchwords. Origin: Dated 1143 AH (1730 or 31) (fol. 10b).
abstract: Contains copies of imperial edicts sent to Crete and petitions presented by Cretans reflecting their social and economic concerns. Ms. likely belonged to an Ottoman bureaucrat in Crete.
extent: 10 leaves : paper ; 215 x 116 (128 x 54) mm. bound to 215 x 121 mm.
title: [Collection of petitions and imperial edicts pertaining to Crete].
subject: Crete (Greece)—History—Turkish rule, 1669-1898—Sources
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
